meanings.definition: Overabstracts: to make excessively abstract or theoretical
meanings.sent1: She always overabstracts her essays, making them hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overabstracts his arguments, losing his audience in complex ideas.
meanings.sent3: The professor overabstracts so much that his students fall asleep in class.
meanings.sent4: Her mind overabstracts reality, creating a world of intricate theories.
meanings.sent5: The artist overabstracts nature, turning simple scenes into complex patterns.

meanings.definition: Overabstracts: excessively abstract or theoretical concepts or ideas
meanings.sent1: The overabstracts concept confused the students, who preferred simpler explanations.
meanings.sent2: Her overabstracts approach to art left many viewers puzzled by its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The overabstracts theory seemed more like a joke than a serious idea.
meanings.sent4: His overabstracts thinking led him to see the world in a completely unique way.
meanings.sent5: The overabstracts painting left the critics debating its true message.
